title: Berry Mousse

ingredients.content: 11 oz fresh mixed red berries (e.g. strawberries, raspberries), plus extra to garnish

preparations.content: Place berries and sugar into mixing bowl and purée <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer approximately 8 oz of puréed berries to a bowl and set aside.

Add gelatin, sprinkling around outside edges avoiding blades and mix <b>30 sec/speed 2<b>, until completely dissolved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat <b>2 min/140°F/speed 1<b>.
Add water and heat <b>2 min/140°F/speed 2<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved puréed berries and ricotta and blend <b>20 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer mixture into a large bowl and refrigerate until gelatin starts to set and mixture has the consistency of heavy cream (approx. 30 min). Clean and dry mixing bowl.

<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place cream into mixing bowl and without setting a time whip <b>speed 3<b>, until desired stiffness is achieved, watching carefully to avoid over-whipping. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>.
Gently fold whipped cream into fruit mixture with spatula.
Divide fruit mousse into dessert bowls and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Garnish with berries and fresh mint leaves and serve chilled.

hintsAndTricks: Serve fruit mousse with a Berry Coulis.
Ricotta cheese can also be replaced with Cloumage, Quark or cream cheese.
